title: War Lance
contents: pftrait | uncommon | deadly d8 | jousting d6 | parry | shove
property | Hands | 2 | Bulk | 2 | Price | 4 gp
property | Category | Martial Weapon | Group | Spear
rule

text | This lance appears shorter and stockier in comparison to other weapons of its type. The war lance most notably features shielding integrated into its vamplate, exchanging its reach for a sturdier base when defending against attacks or attempting to overpower an opponent.

title: Bladed Gauntlet
contents: pftrait | uncommon | agile | finesse | free-hand | modular B, P, or S
property | Hands | 1 | Bulk | L | Price | 5 gp
property | Category | Martial Weapon | Group | Brawling
rule

text | A dagger attached to a retractable mechanism is integrated in this gauntlet's dorsum, so a combatant can quickly arm themself with a blade to exploit the weak points in an enemy's armor. Switching configurations on the gauntlet reveals or retracts the contained dagger as appropriate. The dagger isn't removable, and thus can't be wielded or etched with runes separately from the gauntlet.

title: Ogre Hook
contents: pftrait | uncommon | deadly d10 | trip
property | Hands | 2 | Bulk | 2 | Price | 1 gp
property | Category | Martial Weapon | Group | Pick
rule

text | Ogres are known for using immense, curved picks called ogre hooks. These uncommon weapons cost 1 gp, deal 1d10 piercing damage, have 2 Bulk, and require two hands to use. Ogre hooks are in the pick weapon group. Ogre hooks have the deadly 1d10 and trip weapon traits.

title: Adze
contents: pftrait | forceful | grippli | sweep
property | Hands | 2 | Bulk | 2 | Price | 1 gp
property | Category | Martial Weapon | Group | Axe
rule

text | A common cutting tool, an adze resembles an axeâ€”but the cutting edge is horizontal, rather than vertical. The adze's shape makes it popular among wood workers, and grippli builders often use them to construct their treetop homes. The tool also serves as an effective weapon, due in part to the immense strength required to swing it.

title: Air Repeater
contents: pftrait | uncommon | agile | repeating
property | Hands | 1 | Bulk | L | Price | 5 gp
property | Category | Simple Weapon | Group | Firearm
rule

text | A thin-barreled firearm that uses a container of pressurized air instead of black powder to propel small metal bullets from an attached cartridge, the air repeater has fallen out of common use in Arcadia due to its poor stopping power, though it's still used occasionally for casual hunting and sport shooting. The air repeater and its longer-ranged, two-handed variant are still valued by some for their ability to allow a shooter to fire multiple rounds without needing to stop to reload or crank to a new chamber. A typical air repeater magazine holds 6 pellets.

title: Aklys
contents: pftrait | uncommon | ranged trip | tethered | thrown 20 ft. | trip
property | Hands | 1 | Bulk | 1 | Price | 5 gp
property | Category | Advanced Weapon | Group | Club
rule

text | The aklys is a throwing club with a hook on one end and a lengthy cord attached to the other. It is an uncommon advanced melee weapon in the club group. It deals 1d6 bludgeoning damage and has 1 Bulk. It requires one hand to use and has the ranged trip, tethered, thrown 20 feet, and trip weapon traits; the new traits are described below. Though aklyses aren't available in most shops, one might be purchased for 5 gp from a vendor that specializes in strange weapons.

title: Alchemical Crossbow
contents: pftrait | uncommon | alchemical
property | Hands | 2 | Bulk | 1 | Price | 25 gp
property | Category | Simple Weapon | Group | Bow
rule

text | This crossbow can deliver alchemically infused bolts. The strange weapon has a metal bracket mounted on the side of the stock near the lath. As an action, you can load a single lesser alchemical bomb into the bracket; this bomb must be one that deals energy damage (such as an acid flask, alchemist's fire, bottled lightning, frost vial, or thunderstone). The next three attacks made with the crossbow deal 1d6 damage of the bomb's damage type in addition to the crossbow's normal damage. If the second and third attacks are not all made within 1 minute of the first attack, the bomb's energy is wasted. These attacks never deal splash damage or other special effects of the bomb and are not modified by any abilities that add to or modify a bomb's effect. The addition of the bracket serves to unbalance the weapon, reducing its range to 30 feet.

text | It otherwise functions as a crossbow (when determining damage, reload, and so on). Creatures use their crossbow proficiency when using the alchemical crossbow. The alchemical crossbow costs 25 gp.

title: Aldori Dueling Sword
contents: pftrait | uncommon | finesse | versatile p
property | Hands | 1 | Bulk | 1 | Price | 2 gp
property | Category | Advanced Weapon | Group | Sword
rule

text | An Aldori dueling sword is a slim, single-bladed dueling sword with a slight curve and a sharp, reinforced point. It deals 1d8 slashing damage. An aldori dueling sword is an advanced one-handed melee weapon in the sword weapon group.

title: Arquebus
contents: pftrait | uncommon | concussive | fatal d12 | kickback
property | Hands | 2 | Bulk | 2 | Price | 10 gp
property | Category | Martial Weapon | Group | Firearm
rule

text | This is a long rifle that offers more range than the average firearm, though the long barrel and ferocious kickback make the weapon particularly unsteady unless a tripod or other stand is used to stabilize it. The arquebus is one of the most commonly used long guns among the soldiers of Dongun Hold and Alkenstar.

title: Asp Coil
contents: pftrait | uncommon | reach | versatile p
property | Hands | 1 | Bulk | 1 | Price | 10 gp
property | Category | Martial Weapon | Group | Sword
rule

text | The asp coil, named both for its slithering striking style and its usage among Aspis Consortium agents, has two forms. In sword form, it resembles an elegant, oddly balanced sword. However, with a twist of the pommel, the blade splits into a series of segments connected by elaborate metal cables. Agents of the Aspis Consortium have access to this weapon.

title: Axe Musket
contents: pftrait | uncommon
property | Hands | 2 | Bulk | 2 | Price | 10 gp
property | Category | Martial Weapon | Group | Firearm
rule
text | This item, favored by firearms-using dwarves and barbarians, takes the form of a sturdy musket with an axeblade attached near the muzzle.

title: Backpack Ballista
contents: pftrait | uncommon
property | Hands | 1+ | Bulk | 2 | Price | 18 gp
property | Category | Martial Weapon | Group | Bow
rule

text | This complex wooden device, worn on the back, contains a miniature ballista on a retractable arm. As an Interact action, you can pull a lever to deploy or retract the ballista. As long as it remains deployed, you must hold the ballista using that hand or some of the components spill out onto the ground, just like dropping any other weapon. While deployed, the device opens and raises the ballista up over your shoulder. While retracted, the ballista and its mount slide down and are concealed within the device. Although a backpack ballista packs a punch, the device is a challenge to operate. Reloading it takes 1 minute and can't be done while worn. As normal, you can't wear a backpack ballista with another backpack.

title: Backpack Catapult
contents: pftrait | uncommon | volley 50 ft.
property | Hands | 1+ | Bulk | 3 | Price | 20 gp
property | Category | Advanced Weapon | Group | Sling
rule

text | This wooden device is worn on the back and contains a miniature catapult mounted on a retractable frame. As an Interact action, you can pull a lever to deploy or retract the catapult. As long as it remains deployed, you must hold the catapult using that hand or some of the components spill out onto the ground, just like dropping any other weapon. While deployed, the device opens and raises the catapult up over your shoulder. While retracted, the catapult and its mount slide down and are concealed within the device. A backpack catapult fires specialized stone spheres that are loaded into the bucket while unworn and retracted, through a sliding hatch; the reloading process takes 1 minute. To prevent misfires and accidental injury, the bucket fully encloses the stone while deployed, only opening when fired. As normal, you can't wear a backpack catapult with another backpack.

title: Bastard Sword
contents: pftrait | two-hand d12
property | Hands | 1 | Bulk | 1 | Price | 4 gp
property | Category | Martial Weapon | Group | Sword
rule
text | This broad-bladed sword, sometimes called the hand-and-a-half sword, has a longer grip so it can be held in one hand or used with two hands to provide extra piercing or slashing power.

title: Battle Axe
contents: pftrait | sweep
property | Hands | 1 | Bulk | 1 | Price | 1 gp
property | Category | Martial Weapon | Group | Axe
rule

text | These axes are designed explicitly as weapons, rather than tools. They typically weigh less, with a shaft reinforced with metal bands or bolts, and have a sharper blade, making them ideal for chopping limbs rather than wood.

title: Battle Lute
contents: pftrait | uncommon | shove | two-hand d8
property | Hands | 1 | Bulk | 1 | Price | 15 gp
property | Category | Simple Weapon | Group | Club
rule

text | This reinforced lute is suitable both for use as a handheld musical instrument and for bashing heads should a crowd turn sour. Its strings are finely braided wires that run along its sturdy metal neck.

title: Bayonet
contents: pftrait | agile | attached to crossbow or firearm | finesse
property | Hands | 1 or 2* | Bulk | L | Price | 2 sp
property | Category | Martial Weapon | Group | Knife
rule

text | This blade or spike can be attached to a crossbow or firearm but, unlike other attached weapons, can be wielded in one hand as its own weapon. When used as a separate weapon, it can't benefit from any runes or abilities that function only for attached weapons.
text | *An attached bayonet or reinforced stock requires the same number of hands as the weapon it's attached to. A detached bayonet requires one hand.

title: Big Boom Gun

property | Hands | 1 | Bulk | 2 | Price | 10 gp
property | Category | Martial Weapon | Group | Firearm
rule

text | Developed by a goblin weaponsmith who missed the 'hand' part of 'hand cannon', this comically-oversized gun has a heavily reinforced barrel and is loaded with a worrisome quantity of gunpowder.
text | This hand cannon is a martial weapon, instead of a simple weapon. It has the fatal d12 trait and a range of 20 feet. It also has the following modified critical failure condition:
fill
property | Critical Failure | The attack misses, the weapon misfires, and you take 1d12 fire damage as it explodes in your face.

title: Black Powder Knuckle Dusters
contents: pftrait | uncommon
property | Hands | 1 | Bulk | L | Price | 8 gp
property | Category | Martial Weapon | Group | Firearm
rule
text | This pair of knuckle dusters is fitted with an explosive charge of black powder within the hollowed spikes of the weapon and a firing mechanism you hold in your hand while in use.

title: Bladed Diabolo
contents: pftrait | uncommon | backswing | disarm | finesse | thrown 40 feet | trip
property | Hands | 2 | Bulk | L | Price | 20 sp
property | Category | Advanced Weapon | Group | Flail
rule

text | This weapon consists of two bladed discs joined by a central axel, and is spun on a rope whose ends are attached to wand-like sticks. The wielder can hurl the diabolo from the rope like a stone from a sling, or swing it on the rope in melee.

title: Bladed Hoop
contents: pftrait | uncommon | finesse | sweep | two-hand d8
property | Hands | 0+ | Bulk | 1 | Price | 25 sp
property | Category | Advanced Weapon | Group | Knife
rule

text | This circular hoop has blades along its outer edge. You can wield it in two hands (using the two-hand damage) or by spinning it around an arm. While you spin the hoop, it gains the free-hand trait. Setting the hoop spinning takes 1 Interact action. In addition to the normal restrictions of the free-hand trait, extended use of the arm for locomotion (such as to Climb) interferes with the hoop's spinning and forces you to Release the hoop. You can't spin a hoop underwater. Keeping the hoop spinning requires a free action each round, which has the concentrate and manipulate traits. You can keep a hoop spinning as an exploration activity, but doing so for more than 10 minutes makes you fatigued, similarly to Hustling.

title: Bladed Scarf
contents: pftrait | uncommon | disarm | finesse | reach | sweep | trip
property | Hands | 2 | Bulk | 1 | Price | 3 gp
property | Category | Martial Weapon | Group | Flail
rule
text | The thin metal plates interwoven throughout this long scarf turn a fashion accessory into a deadly weapon.

title: Blowgun
contents: pftrait | agile | nonlethal
property | Hands | 1 | Bulk | L | Price | 1 sp
property | Category | Simple Weapon | Group | Dart
rule
text | This long, narrow tube is used for shooting blowgun darts, using only the power of a forcefully exhaled breath.

title: Blunderbuss
contents: pftrait | uncommon | concussive | scatter 10 ft.
property | Hands | 2 | Bulk | 2 | Price | 8 gp
property | Category | Martial Weapon | Group | Firearm
rule

text | This weapon fires pellets from a trumpet-shaped barrel, making it an excellent choice for hunting brush fowl or dealing damage within a short, broad area. Adventuring gunslingers often carry a blunderbuss to deal with swarms of vermin and similar threats.

title: Bo Staff
contents: pftrait | monk | parry | reach | trip
property | Hands | 2 | Bulk | 2 | Price | 2 sp
property | Category | Martial Weapon | Group | Club
rule
text | This strong but slender staff is tapered at the ends and well balanced. It's designed to be an offensive and defensive weapon.

title: Boarding Axe
contents: pftrait | uncommon | agile | azarketi | climbing | versatile p
property | Hands | 1 | Bulk | L | Price | 1 gp
property | Category | Martial Weapon | Group | Axe
rule

text | This small axe sports a spike opposite the blade that aids in climbing and is useful in clearing obstacles, such as fallen rigging. This weapon is common in the High Seas region, on the Isle of Kortos and within azarketi settlements.

title: Boarding Pike
contents: pftrait | uncommon | reach | shove
property | Hands | 2 | Bulk | 2 | Price | 8 sp
property | Category | Martial Weapon | Group | Polearm
rule

text | Taking the form of a longspear fitted with crossbars or hooks, a boarding pike provides its wielder a sharp implement that's as adept at shoving enemies off a ship's railings as facilitating the boarding of other vessels. This is a martial melee weapon.

title: Bola
contents: pftrait | uncommon | nonlethal | ranged trip | thrown
property | Hands | 1 | Bulk | L | Price | 5 sp
property | Category | Martial Weapon | Group | Sling
rule
text | This throwing weapon consists of weights tied to the end of long cords, which can be used to bludgeon foes or entangle their legs.

title: Armored Coat
contents: pftrait | comfort | flexible
property | Bulk | 2 | Price | 20 gp
property | AC Bonus | +2 | Dex Cap | +2
property | Str Req. | 14 | Check Penalty | --1
property | Category | Light Armor | Group | Leather
rule

text | A custom, lightweight mail is fitted within the lining of a coat or similar apparel, physically hiding the armor while maintaining the wearer's fashion. While not nearly as protective as heavier armors, the armored coat allows the wearer to blend in more aesthetically during civilian functions. Like other suits of armor, the armored coat is custom-fitted to an individual's body type, ensuring comfort without sacrificing its defensive capabilities.

title: Breastplate
contents: property | Bulk | 2 | Price | 8 gp
property | AC Bonus | +4 | Dex Cap | +1
property | Str Req. | 16 | Check Penalty | --2 | Speed Penalty | --5 ft.
property | Category | Medium Armor | Group | Plate
rule

text | Though referred to as a breastplate, this type of armor consists of several pieces of plate or half plate armor that protect the torso, chest, neck, and sometimes the hips and lower legs. It strategically grants some of the protection of plate while allowing greater flexibility and speed.

title: Buckler
contents: property | Bulk | L | Price | 1 gp
rule

text | This very small shield is a favorite of duelists and quick, lightly armored warriors. It's typically made of steel and strapped to your forearm. You can Raise a Shield with your buckler as long as you have that hand free or are holding a light object that's not a weapon in that hand.

title: Butchering Axe
contents: pftrait | uncommon | orc | shove | sweep
property | Hands | 2 | Bulk | 2 | Price | 8 gp
property | Category | Advanced Weapon | Group | Axe
rule

text | Invented by Belkzen's zealous Steel-Eaters, the butchering axe has an oversized head and a long, thick haft counterbalanced with steel or stone. The weapon's sweeping strokes inflict immense damage, particularly against groups of foes, and can push dangerous opponents away to a safe distance. All of these qualities are particularly useful against the lumbering zombie hordes of the Whispering Tyrant. Correspondingly, butchering axes are often wielded by orc and half-orc Crimson Reclaimers of Lastwall.

title: Butterfly Sword
contents: pftrait | uncommon | agile | disarm | finesse | monk | parry | twin
property | Hands | 1 | Bulk | L | Price | 2 gp
property | Category | Advanced Weapon | Group | Sword
rule
text | This short, single-edged sword typically features a cross guard that helps catch oncoming attacks. It is the preferred weapon of Butterfly Bladesâ€”highly skilled Gokan assassins.

title: Buugeng
contents: pftrait | uncommon | agile | conrasu | sweep | twin
property | Hands | 1 | Bulk | 1 | Price | 4 gp
property | Category | Martial Weapon | Group | Sword
rule

text | A blade of conrasu design, a buugeng has a unique, curved shape that allows it to rotate smoothly in the hand of a trained warrior. This spinning motion makes it easier to attack multiple foes at once with the weapon.

title: Cane Pistol
contents: pftrait | uncommon
property | Hands | 1 | Bulk | 1 | Price | 8 gp
property | Category | Martial Weapon | Group | Firearm
rule
text | This fashionable cane's handle hides a dueling pistol fired through the thin, painted cap at the bottom of the cane.

title: Chain Mail
contents: pftrait | flexible | noisy
property | Bulk | 2 | Price | 6 gp
property | AC Bonus | +4 | Dex Cap | +1
property | Str Req. | 16 | Check Penalty | --2 | Speed Penalty | --5 ft.
property | Category | Medium Armor | Group | Chain
rule

text | A suit of chain mail consists of several pieces of armor composed of small metal rings linked together in a protective mesh. It typically includes a chain shirt, leggings, a pair of arms, and a coif, collectively protecting most of the body.

title: Chain Shirt
contents: pftrait | flexible | noisy
property | Bulk | 1 | Price | 5 gp
property | AC Bonus | +2 | Dex Cap | +3
property | Str Req. | 12 | Check Penalty | --1
property | Category | Light Armor | Group | Chain
rule

text | Sometimes called a hauberk, this is a long shirt constructed of the same metal rings as chainmail. However, it is much lighter than chainmail and protects only the torso, upper arms, and upper legs of its wearer.

title: Chakram
contents: pftrait | thrown
property | Hands | 1 | Bulk | L | Price | 5 sp
property | Category | Martial Weapon | Group | Knife
rule
text | Simple, elegant, and portable, the chakram is an open-centered metal discus with a sharpened edge, as well as a grip running along the center so the wielder can hold it safely.

title: Clan Dagger
contents: pftrait | uncommon | agile | dwarf | parry | versatile b
property | Hands | 1 | Bulk | L | Price | 2 gp
property | Category | Simple Weapon | Group | Knife
rule
text | This broad dagger is carried by dwarves as a weapon, tool, and designation of clan. Losing or having to surrender a clan dagger is considered a mark of embarrassment to most dwarves.

title: Clan Pistol
contents: pftrait | uncommon | concussive | dwarf | fatal d10
property | Hands | 1 | Bulk | L | Price | 5 gp
property | Category | Martial Weapon | Group | Firearm
rule

text | The tradition of dwarves displaying their clan affiliations with special clan daggers goes back millennia, but many of the dwarf clans of Dongun Hold have their own take on the tradition, with promising young gunsmiths claiming their adulthood by crafting a specialized personal firearm using the clan's unique smithing traditions. Losing or being forced to surrender their clan pistol is a terrible embarrassment for the dwarves that carry them.

title: Claw Blade
contents: pftrait | uncommon | agile | catfolk | deadly d8 | disarm | finesse | versatile p
property | Hands | 1 | Bulk | L | Price | 2 gp
property | Category | Martial Weapon | Group | Knife
rule

text | The three parallel blades of this handheld weapon extend between the fingers to resemble the natural claws of the amurruns who created them, providing a way for those catfolk without suitable natural claws to share the fighting customs of their kin.

title: Clockwork Disguise
contents: pftrait | uncommon | clockwork
property | Bulk | 2 | Price | 200 gp
property | AC Bonus | +2 | Dex Cap | +3
property | Str Req. | 12 | Check Penalty | --1
property | Category | Light Armor | Group | Plate
rule

text | Sometimes, just disguising one's face just isn't convincing enough. Clockwork disguises were invented to supplement regular disguise kits, which are used all across Golarion. For example, if a spy wants to infiltrate a military camp, they must be wearing the same type of armor as the soldiers stationed thereâ€”or else have a very good explanation for their commander as to why they're out of proper uniform! The clockwork disguise is intended to help avoid such awkward, potentially fatal confrontations.

text | The clockwork disguise looks like a harness connected to hundreds of small metal plates that cover the user's torso and arms. Each of these plates is equipped with several hinges, allowing them to be shaped into a wide variety of patterns. When these shaped plates are arranged and connected, they can be made to look like almost any basic suit of light or medium metal armor, though armor embellishments such as those worn by highranking officers are beyond this device. The arrangement process takes some time, but once it's completed, the user need only perform a few simple adjustments to a clockwork mechanism in the disguise to make the plate arrangement into a new preset configuration. Afterwards, when the user flips a switch on the harness's belt to one of three positions, the plates shift, overlap, and connect as necessary to transform the disguise into the desired preset configuration. The clockwork disguise can have up to three preset configurations at a time, and most users use a minimum of two: the one required for their current task, and a suitably inconspicuous configuration for when the first configuration is unnecessary.

text | Giving a clockwork disguise a new preset configuration requires 20 minutes of work. The clockwork disguise can have a maximum of three preset configurations at a time, and it can only mimic light and medium armor suits made of metal.
text | The clockwork disguise is light armor and has the stats listed above, regardless of which type of armor it mimics.
